meanings.definition: A slice of meat, typically beef, cooked by broiling, frying, or grilling.
meanings.sent1: Dad grilled a tasty steak for dinner.
meanings.sent2: I ordered a medium-rare steak at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The steak sizzled on the hot grill, making everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a well-cooked steak, satisfying and comforting.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the steak filled the kitchen, making my mouth water.

meanings.definition: A thick, firm piece of fish or meat for cooking or grilling.
meanings.sent1: The chef seasoned the steak before putting it on the grill.
meanings.sent2: She bought a fresh salmon steak for the barbecue.
meanings.sent3: The steak flopped out of the pan and onto the floor, causing a mess.
meanings.sent4: His muscles felt as tough as a well-cooked steak after the workout.
meanings.sent5: The steak sizzled as it cooked, releasing a delicious smell.

meanings.definition: A thick slice of any food.
meanings.sent1: She cut a thick steak of bread for the sandwich.
meanings.sent2: The chef placed a juicy steak of watermelon on the plate.
meanings.sent3: The steak of cheese was so big, it covered the entire cracker.
meanings.sent4: The sun set behind the mountains, casting a steak of light across the sky.
meanings.sent5: He took a steak of cake from the tray, enjoying every bite.
